author: Special Correspondent
text:
One lakh saplings being planted to mark women’s day

V.M. Muthukumar, Vice-Chancellor planting a sapling as part of the greening drive to mark the Women's Day at Bharathidasan University.

Bharathidasan University on Wednesday launched a scheme of mass plantation of one lakh saplings on the occasion of International Women’s Day.

The saplings will be planted both on the university campuses and in various affiliated colleges.

Vice-Chancellor V.M. Muthukumar inaugurated the scheme by planting a sapling on the main campus. During the inaugural function, saplings of different kinds of trees were distributed among the NSS programme offices of the affiliated colleges of the university.

Later, speaking at the valediction of refresher courses on political science, physics, and history organized by the UGC Human Resource Development Centre of the Bharathidasan University, he said concerted efforts were made to enhance the greenery. Rainwater harvesting had boosted the groundwater level in the university. Percolation ponds had been strengthened. Stressing the need for updating the knowledge on various subjects, Mr. Muthukumar said it was important for teachers to stay up-to-date. Otherwise, they would be outsmarted by students.

On International Women’s Day, he said women had been making indelible mark in their respective fields. There were several role models, including Malala Yousafzai and Kalpana Chawla. The young women should emulate them.

E. Ramganesh, Director-In-Charge, UGC Human Resource Development Centre, spoke.
title: Varsity launches greening drive
